title: How to appeal denial of motion to vacate judgement due to duress, coersion, undue influence and fraud?
question: I filed a motion with the the California court to vacate stipulated judgment due to mental incapacity, duress, coercion, and fraud. the judge has something against me and denied my motion. I would like to appeal this decision... I believe the statue of limitations to vacate an order is at least a year and I filed my motion well within that time period. is this decision appealable? do I appeal the judgment or do I appeal the motion that got denied?
answers:
The time limit is 6 months.

You can appeal.
Since a judgment is entered you can appeal the order
